carousel_items: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

basics.benefits_moa: Medrol is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Medrol is corticosteroid available in many forms (oral, injectable) that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Medrol.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.

downsides_processed.orig: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Medrol.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.

upsides: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Useful in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.
Available in many different forms, including injection, that will expose the rest of your body less of the medicine.

upsides_processed.orig: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Useful in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.
Available in many different forms, including injection, that will expose the rest of your body less of the medicine.

drugs.name: Medrol

carousel_items_processed.orig: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Medrol too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Medrol dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Medrol too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Medrol dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Medrol for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Medrol and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

description_processed.orig: It’s rare, but taking Medrol for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Medrol and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Medrol may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

description_processed.orig: Medrol may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Medrol may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Medrol may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Medrol can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Medrol can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Medrol if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Medrol to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Taking Medrol if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Medrol to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Medrol increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers
Taking Medrol with other medicine that can cause stomach problems

description_processed.orig: Taking Medrol increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Medrol for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Medrol. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Medrol if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

description_processed.orig: If you take Medrol for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Medrol. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Medrol if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

points.name: Congestive heart failure in susceptible patients
Aseptic necrosis of femoral and humeral heads
Peptic ulcer with possible perforation and hemorrhage
Increases ALT, SGPT, AST, SGOT, and alkaline phosphatase
May suppress reactions to skin tests
Increased requirements of insulin or oral hypoglycemic agents in diabetics

Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

clock.tip: Works better if taken with a high-fat meal.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisone is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisone is a common oral corticosteroid that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

userStories.tip: I have taken Prednisone on and off as low dose therapy to control Lupus and MS, but it caused a sandpaper rash all over my arms and face so doctor terminated the treatment. Weight gain was a definite issue for me.
Made my foot cramp and fall asleep. Also blurred vision!

SO SO hard to come off of...autoimmune chronic inflammatory issue--the rebound effect is vicious, and coming off prednisone makes me suicidal and want to self harm. Staying on prednisone makes me retain water and become hyper irritable.
Caused weight loss, muscle wasting and thinning of the bones
Never take on an empty stomach. Take the lowest dosage that is effective.
It has many more side effects than it's worth.. : /

userStories.identifier: Parent, work out when I can

points.name: Congestive heart failure in susceptible patients
Aseptic necrosis of femoral and humeral heads
Peptic ulcer with possible perforation and hemorrhage
May suppress reactions to skin tests

carousel_items: Given as an intravenous infusion.
Eat normally and drink at least two glasses of liquid before your infusion.
Talk to your doctor if you develop swelling, pain, or a sore in your jaw.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your hips, thighs or legs.
You can take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to lower fever and chills from the infusion.
If you have to have dental or oral surgery, tell your surgeon that you're taking this medication.
Drink plenty of liquids while you're on this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Reclast is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Reclast is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but you have to see a doctor to get each dose.
downsides: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

upsides: You only have to take this once a year.

upsides_processed.orig: You only have to take this once a year.

userStories.tip: After IV injection had severe inflammatory reaction for 3 days, bed ridden with chills, high fever and severe muscle and bone pains

drugs.name: Reclast

carousel_items_processed.orig: Given as an intravenous infusion.
Eat normally and drink at least two glasses of liquid before your infusion.
Talk to your doctor if you develop swelling, pain, or a sore in your jaw.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your hips, thighs or legs.
You can take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to lower fever and chills from the infusion.
If you have to have dental or oral surgery, tell your surgeon that you're taking this medication.
Drink plenty of liquids while you're on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pain in the bones and muscles
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Reclast.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Reclast.

risks_warnings.title: Leg bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Low calcium in the blood
risks_warnings.description: People on Reclast who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: People on Reclast who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: Can be taken as a tablet or as an intravenous infusion.
Take the tablet first thing when you wake up by swallowing the whole pill with a full glass of plain water.
Don't eat or drink anything for 60 minutes after you've taken the tablet.
Stay sitting or standing, and Don't take any other medications, vitamins or supplements for at least 60 minutes after you take the tablet until you've had your first food of the day.
If you have pain with swallowing, around your chest or stomach, or new or worsening heartburn, talk to your doctor.
Take the 150 mg tablet on the same day every month.
If you forget to take the 150mg tablet on your chosen day each month, take it on the next day in the morning.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your jaw, hips or thighs.
Keep taking your calcium and vitamin D.
Some of these medications are only taken once a month, others once a day. Talk to your pharmacist if you're not sure.
Consider adding weight-bearing exercises as part of your exercise routine.

basics.benefits_moa: Boniva is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Boniva is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but how you have to take it can be a hassle. It's also only approved for women, not men.
downsides: You have to take it first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
You have to remain upright for at least 60 minutes after you take the medication, which can be a problem if you have mobility issues.
Only approved to treat and prevent osteoporosis in women who have gone through menopause.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take it first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
You have to remain upright for at least 60 minutes after you take the medication, which can be a problem if you have mobility issues.
Only approved to treat and prevent osteoporosis in women who have gone through menopause.

upsides: Available in oral tablets that can be given once a month or once a day.
Also available as shot given into your vein every 3 months.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in oral tablets that can be given once a month or once a day.
Also available as shot given into your vein every 3 months.

userStories.tip: Muscle aches, joint pain, 4 finger joints swelled, fever, headache.  I could barely walk to the kitchen and bathroom.  Took 10 tries to get up out of the chair.

drugs.name: Boniva

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can be taken as a tablet or as an intravenous infusion.
Take the tablet first thing when you wake up by swallowing the whole pill with a full glass of plain water.
Don't eat or drink anything for 60 minutes after you've taken the tablet.
Stay sitting or standing, and Don't take any other medications, vitamins or supplements for at least 60 minutes after you take the tablet until you've had your first food of the day.
If you have pain with swallowing, around your chest or stomach, or new or worsening heartburn, talk to your doctor.
Take the 150 mg tablet on the same day every month.
If you forget to take the 150mg tablet on your chosen day each month, take it on the next day in the morning.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your jaw, hips or thighs.
Keep taking your calcium and vitamin D.
Some of these medications are only taken once a month, others once a day. Talk to your pharmacist if you're not sure.
Consider adding weight-bearing exercises as part of your exercise routine.

risks_warnings.title: Irritation and ulcers to the stomach and esophagus
risks_warnings.description: People on the oral version of Boniva have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

description_processed.orig: People on the oral version of Boniva have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pain in the bones and muscles
risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: People on Boniva have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Boniva.

description_processed.orig: People on Boniva have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Boniva.

risks_warnings.title: Leg bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: People on Boniva have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Low calcium in the blood
risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: People on Boniva who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: Take Fosamax first thing in the morning with a full glass of water before eating or drinking anything else, including other medicines.
The pill must be swallowed whole.
Stay upright for at least 30 minutes after taking the medicine, and don't eat or drink anything except plain water during that time.
Make sure you take enough calcium and vitamin D to allow this medicine to work.
Can cause an upset stomach, joint pain, back pain, or heartburn.
Stop taking the medicine and let your doctor know if swallowing becomes painful, if you have chest pain, or if any of the side effects worsen.
If you have dental work coming up, get it done before starting this medicine since some people have experienced serious jaw problems while on Fosamax.

clock.tip: Works more slowly when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Fosamax is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Fosamax is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but taking it can be a hassle.
downsides: You need to take it the first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
Not good for people who can't sit or stand upright for at least 30 minutes in the morning.
The use of bisphosphonates increases your risk of other types of fractures not related to osteoporosis (called atypical fractures).
Can cause bad heartburn or stomach problems.

downsides_processed.orig: You need to take it the first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
Not good for people who can't sit or stand upright for at least 30 minutes in the morning.
The use of bisphosphonates increases your risk of other types of fractures not related to osteoporosis (called atypical fractures).
Can cause bad heartburn or stomach problems.

upsides: Lowers your risk of bone fractures.
Available in two forms: one that can be taken once a day or another that's taken once a week.
Comes as a regular tablet, an oral solution, or effervescent tablets meant to be dissolved in water.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers your risk of bone fractures.
Available in two forms: one that can be taken once a day or another that's taken once a week.
Comes as a regular tablet, an oral solution, or effervescent tablets meant to be dissolved in water.

userStories.identifier: On disability due to a neck injury.
userStories.tip: Must take on an empty stomach, first thing in am, with a full glass of water (only water). Must stay upright (either standing or sitting up) for at least a half hour. May cause esophagus irritation or ulcers. May cause reflux.

userStories.identifier: Used to be a very active senior.
userStories.tip: DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG! I was on it for 10 yrs when my right femur broke while taking a simple walk. Xrays showed that my left femur had a hairline facture and would break eventually, so I now have rods in both legs and never without pain.
I wish I had known about the effects on the jaw bone (osteonecrosis)

drugs.name: Fosamax

condition_url_name: Bone loss in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Fosamax first thing in the morning with a full glass of water before eating or drinking anything else, including other medicines.
The pill must be swallowed whole.
Stay upright for at least 30 minutes after taking the medicine, and don't eat or drink anything except plain water during that time.
Make sure you take enough calcium and vitamin D to allow this medicine to work.
Can cause an upset stomach, joint pain, back pain, or heartburn.
Stop taking the medicine and let your doctor know if swallowing becomes painful, if you have chest pain, or if any of the side effects worsen.
If you have dental work coming up, get it done before starting this medicine since some people have experienced serious jaw problems while on Fosamax.
